turn_1.Human: <|Human|>: Some people think Australia Day should be renamed Invasion Day, why?<eoh>
turn_1.MOSS: <|MOSS|>: There is a growing movement in Australia to rename Australia Day as Invasion Day. This is because January 26 marks the anniversary of the arrival of the First Fleet of British ships in 1788, which led to the colonization and displacement of Indigenous Australians. For many Indigenous Australians, this day represents the beginning of a long history of violence, dispossession, and discrimination. Renaming the day as Invasion Day is seen as a way to acknowledge and respect the experiences and perspectives of Indigenous Australians and to encourage national reflection and reconciliation.<eom>

I would encourage any social media campaign to promote peaceful and respectful actions that bring people together rather than divide them.<eom>
